an5.170:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ānando kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
an5.170:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

an5.170:1.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā bhaddaji yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṃ sammodi.
an5.170:1.2.eng: Then Venerable Bhaddaji went up to Venerable Ānanda, and exchanged greetings with him.

an5.170:1.3.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ bhaddajiṃ āyasmā ānando etadavoca:
an5.170:1.3.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and Venerable Ānanda said to him:

an5.170:1.4.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, āvuso bhaddaji, dassanānaṃ aggaṃ, kiṃ savanānaṃ aggaṃ, kiṃ sukhānaṃ aggaṃ, kiṃ saññānaṃ aggaṃ, kiṃ bhavānaṃ aggan”ti?
an5.170:1.4.eng: “Reverend Bhaddaji, what is the best sight, the best sound, the best happiness, the best perception, and the best state of existence?”

an5.170:2.1.pli: “Atthāvuso, brahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī, yo taṃ brahmānaṃ passati, idaṃ dassanānaṃ aggaṃ.
an5.170:2.1.eng: “Reverend, there is this Divinity, the vanquisher, the unvanquished, the universal seer, the wielder of power. When you see the Divinity, that’s the best sight.

an5.170:2.2.pli: Atthāvuso, ābhassarā nāma devā sukhena abhisannā parisannā.
an5.170:2.2.eng: There are the gods called ‘of streaming radiance’, who are drenched and steeped in pleasure.

an5.170:2.3.eng: Every so often they feel inspired to exclaim:

an5.170:2.5.pli: Yo taṃ saddaṃ suṇāti, idaṃ savanānaṃ aggaṃ.
an5.170:2.5.eng: When you hear that, it’s the best sound.

an5.170:2.6.eng: There are the gods called ‘of universal beauty’.

an5.170:2.7.pli: Te santaṃyeva tusitā sukhaṃ paṭivedenti, idaṃ sukhānaṃ aggaṃ.
an5.170:2.7.eng: Since they’re truly content, they experience pleasure. This is the best happiness.

an5.170:2.8.pli: Atthāvuso, ākiñcaññāyatanūpagā devā, idaṃ saññānaṃ aggaṃ.
an5.170:2.8.eng: There are the gods reborn in the dimension of nothingness. This is the best perception.

an5.170:2.9.pli: Atthāvuso, nevasaññānāsaññāyatanūpagā devā, idaṃ bhavānaṃ aggan”ti.
an5.170:2.9.eng: There are the gods reborn in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. This is the best state of existence.”

an5.170:2.10.pli: “Sameti kho idaṃ āyasmato bhaddajissa, yadidaṃ bahunā janenā”ti?
an5.170:2.10.eng: “So, Venerable Bhaddaji, do you agree with what most people say about this?”

an5.170:3.2.eng: Why don’t you clarify this yourself?”

an5.170:3.3.pli: “Tenahāvuso bhaddaji, suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
an5.170:3.3.eng: “Well then, Reverend Bhaddaji, listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an5.170:3.4.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā bhaddaji āyasmato ānandassa paccassosi.

an5.170:4.1.pli: “Yathā passato kho, āvuso, anantarā āsavānaṃ khayo hoti, idaṃ dassanānaṃ aggaṃ.
an5.170:4.1.eng: “What you see when the defilements are ended without delay is the best sight.

an5.170:4.2.pli: Yathā suṇato anantarā āsavānaṃ khayo hoti, idaṃ savanānaṃ aggaṃ.
an5.170:4.2.eng: What you hear when the defilements are ended without delay is the best sound.

an5.170:4.3.pli: Yathā sukhitassa anantarā āsavānaṃ khayo hoti, idaṃ sukhānaṃ aggaṃ.
an5.170:4.3.eng: The happiness you feel when the defilements are ended without delay is the best happiness.

an5.170:4.4.pli: Yathā saññissa anantarā āsavānaṃ khayo hoti, idaṃ saññānaṃ aggaṃ.
an5.170:4.4.eng: What you perceive when the defilements are ended without delay is the best perception.

an5.170:4.5.pli: Yathā bhūtassa anantarā āsavānaṃ khayo hoti, idaṃ bhavānaṃ aggan”ti.
an5.170:4.5.eng: The state of existence in which the defilements are ended without delay is the best state of existence.”

an5.171:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
an5.171:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

an5.171:1.3.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

an5.171:2.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato upāsako sārajjaṃ okkanto hoti.
an5.171:2.1.eng: “A lay follower with five qualities is overcome by timidity.

an5.171:2.3.pli: Pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī hoti, musāvādī hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyī hoti.
an5.171:2.3.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.171:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato upāsako sārajjaṃ okkanto hoti.
an5.171:2.4.eng: A lay follower with these five qualities is overcome by timidity.

an5.171:3.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato upāsako visārado hoti.
an5.171:3.1.eng: A lay follower with five qualities is self-assured.

an5.171:3.3.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti.
an5.171:3.3.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.171:3.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato upāsako visārado hotī”ti.
an5.171:3.4.eng: A lay follower with these five qualities is self-assured.”

an5.172:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato upāsako avisārado agāraṃ ajjhāvasati.
an5.172:1.1.eng: “A lay follower living at home with five qualities is not self-assured.

an5.172:1.3.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.172:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato upāsako avisārado agāraṃ ajjhāvasati.
an5.172:1.4.eng: A lay follower living at home with these five qualities is not self-assured.

an5.172:2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato upāsako visārado agāraṃ ajjhāvasati.
an5.172:2.1.eng: A lay follower living at home with these five qualities is self-assured.

an5.172:2.3.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti.
an5.172:2.3.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.172:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato upāsako visārado agāraṃ ajjhāvasatī”ti.
an5.172:2.4.eng: A lay follower living at home with these five qualities is self-assured.”

an5.173:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato upāsako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an5.173:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a lay follower with five qualities is cast down to hell.

an5.173:1.3.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.173:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato upāsako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an5.173:1.4.eng: A lay follower with these five qualities is cast down to hell.

an5.173:2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato upāsako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an5.173:2.1.eng: A lay follower with five qualities is raised up to heaven.

an5.173:2.3.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti.
an5.173:2.3.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.173:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato upāsako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an5.173:2.4.eng: A lay follower with these five qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an5.174:1.1.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
an5.174:1.1.eng: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

an5.174:2.1.pli: “Pañca, gahapati, bhayāni verāni appahāya ‘dussīlo’ iti vuccati, nirayañca upapajjati.
an5.174:2.1.eng: “Householder, unless these five fears and enmities are given up, one is said to be unethical, and is reborn in hell.

an5.174:2.3.eng: Killing living creatures, stealing, committing sexual misconduct, lying, and consuming beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.174:2.4.pli: imāni kho, gahapati, pañca bhayāni verāni appahāya ‘dussīlo’ iti vuccati, nirayañca upapajjati.
an5.174:2.4.eng: Unless these five fears and enmities are given up, one is said to be unethical, and is reborn in hell.

an5.174:3.1.pli: Pañca, gahapati, bhayāni verāni pahāya ‘sīlavā’ iti vuccati, sugatiñca upapajjati.
an5.174:3.1.eng: Once these five fears and enmities are given up, one is said to be ethical, and is reborn in heaven.

an5.174:3.3.eng: Killing living creatures, stealing, committing sexual misconduct, lying, and consuming beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.174:3.4.pli: imāni kho, gahapati, pañca bhayāni verāni pahāya ‘sīlavā’ iti vuccati, sugatiñca upapajjati.
an5.174:3.4.eng: Once these five fears and enmities are given up, one is said to be ethical, and is reborn in heaven.

an5.174:4.1.pli: Yaṃ, gahapati, pāṇātipātī pāṇātipātapaccayā diṭṭhadhammikampi bhayaṃ veraṃ pasavati, samparāyikampi bhayaṃ veraṃ pasavati, cetasikampi dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, pāṇātipātā paṭivirato neva diṭṭhadhammikaṃ bhayaṃ veraṃ pasavati, na samparāyikaṃ bhayaṃ veraṃ pasavati, na cetasikaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti.
an5.174:4.1.eng: Anyone who kills living creatures brims with fear and enmity both in this life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. Anyone who refrains from killing living creatures does not brim with fear and enmity either in this life or in lives to come, and doesn’t experience mental pain and sadness.

an5.174:4.2.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭiviratassa evaṃ taṃ bhayaṃ veraṃ vūpasantaṃ hoti.
an5.174:4.2.eng: So that fear and enmity is quelled for anyone who refrains from killing living creatures.

an5.174:8.1.pli: Yaṃ, gahapati, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyī surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānapaccayā diṭṭhadhammikampi bhayaṃ veraṃ pasavati, samparāyikampi bhayaṃ veraṃ pasavati, cetasikampi dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato neva diṭṭhadhammikaṃ bhayaṃ veraṃ pasavati, na samparāyikaṃ bhayaṃ veraṃ pasavati, na cetasikaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti.
an5.174:8.1.eng: Anyone who consumes beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants brims with fear and enmity both in this life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. Anyone who refrains from consuming beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants does not brim with fear and enmity either in this life or in lives to come, and doesn’t experience mental pain and sadness.

an5.174:8.2.pli: Surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭiviratassa evaṃ taṃ bhayaṃ veraṃ vūpasantaṃ hotīti.
an5.174:8.2.eng: So that fear and enmity is quelled for anyone who refrains from consuming beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.174:10.1.eng: Unless they give up these five threats,

an5.174:10.3.eng: When their body breaks up, that witless person

an5.174:11.1.eng: A person in the world doesn’t kill living creatures,

an5.174:12.3.eng: When their body breaks up, that wise person

an5.174:12.4.eng: is reborn in a good place.”

an5.175:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato upāsako upāsakacaṇḍālo ca hoti upāsakamalañca upāsakapatikuṭṭho ca.
an5.175:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a lay follower with five qualities is a corpse-worker, a stain, and a reject among lay followers.

an5.175:1.5.pli: kotūhalamaṅgaliko hoti, maṅgalaṃ pacceti no kammaṃ;
an5.175:1.5.eng: They follow boisterous, superstitious rites, believing in omens rather than deeds.

an5.175:1.6.eng: They seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.

an5.175:1.7.eng: And they make offerings there first.

an5.175:1.8.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato upāsako upāsakacaṇḍālo ca hoti upāsakamalañca upāsakapatikuṭṭho ca.
an5.175:1.8.eng: A lay follower with these five qualities is a corpse-worker, a stain, and a reject among lay followers.

an5.175:2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato upāsako upāsakaratanañca hoti upāsakapadumañca upāsakapuṇḍarīkañca.
an5.175:2.1.eng: A lay follower with five qualities is a gem, a pink lotus, and a white lotus among lay followers.

an5.175:2.5.pli: akotūhalamaṅgaliko hoti, kammaṃ pacceti no maṅgalaṃ;
an5.175:2.5.eng: They don’t practice boisterous, superstitious rites, and believe in deeds rather than omens.

an5.175:2.6.eng: They don’t seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.

an5.175:2.7.eng: And they don’t make offerings there first.

an5.175:2.8.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato upāsako upāsakaratanañca hoti upāsakapadumañca upāsakapuṇḍarīkañcā”ti.
an5.175:2.8.eng: A lay follower with these five qualities is a gem, a pink lotus, and a white lotus among lay followers.”

an5.176:1.1.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati pañcamattehi upāsakasatehi parivuto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
an5.176:1.1.eng: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika, escorted by around five hundred lay followers, went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

an5.176:2.1.eng: “Householders, you have supplied the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an5.176:2.2.pli: Na kho, gahapati, tāvatakeneva tuṭṭhi karaṇīyā:
an5.176:2.2.eng: But you should not be content with just this much.

an5.176:2.4.eng: So you should train like this:

an5.176:2.5.pli: ‘kinti mayaṃ kālena kālaṃ pavivekaṃ pītiṃ upasampajja vihareyyāmā’ti.
an5.176:2.5.eng: ‘How can we, from time to time, enter and dwell in the rapture of seclusion?’

an5.176:3.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an5.176:3.1.eng: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to the Buddha,

an5.176:3.3.eng: How well said this was by the Buddha:

an5.176:3.4.eng: ‘Householders, you have supplied the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an5.176:3.5.pli: Na kho, gahapati, tāvatakeneva tuṭṭhi karaṇīyā—
an5.176:3.5.eng: But you should not be content with just this much.

an5.176:3.7.eng: So you should train like this:

an5.176:3.8.pli: kinti mayaṃ kālena kālaṃ pavivekaṃ pītiṃ upasampajja vihareyyāmāti.
an5.176:3.8.eng: “How can we, from time to time, enter and dwell in the rapture of seclusion?”

an5.176:3.10.pli: Yasmiṃ, bhante, samaye ariyasāvako pavivekaṃ pītiṃ upasampajja viharati, pañcassa ṭhānāni tasmiṃ samaye na honti.
an5.176:3.10.eng: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, five things aren’t present in him.

an5.176:3.11.pli: Yampissa kāmūpasaṃhitaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ, tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an5.176:3.11.eng: The pain and sadness connected with sensual pleasures.

an5.176:3.12.pli: Yampissa kāmūpasaṃhitaṃ sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an5.176:3.12.eng: The pleasure and happiness connected with sensual pleasures.

an5.176:3.13.pli: Yampissa akusalūpasaṃhitaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ, tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an5.176:3.13.eng: The pain and sadness connected with the unskillful.

an5.176:3.14.pli: Yampissa akusalūpasaṃhitaṃ sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an5.176:3.14.eng: The pleasure and happiness connected with the unskillful.

an5.176:3.15.pli: Yampissa kusalūpasaṃhitaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ, tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an5.176:3.15.eng: The pain and sadness connected with the skillful.

an5.176:3.16.pli: Yasmiṃ, bhante, samaye ariyasāvako pavivekaṃ pītiṃ upasampajja viharati, imānissa pañca ṭhānāni tasmiṃ samaye na hontī”ti.
an5.176:3.16.eng: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, these five things aren’t present in him.”

an5.176:4.2.pli: Yasmiṃ, sāriputta, samaye ariyasāvako pavivekaṃ pītiṃ upasampajja viharati, pañcassa ṭhānāni tasmiṃ samaye na honti.
an5.176:4.2.eng: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, five things aren’t present in him.

an5.176:4.3.pli: Yampissa kāmūpasaṃhitaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ, tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an5.176:4.3.eng: The pain and sadness connected with sensual pleasures.

an5.176:4.4.pli: Yampissa kāmūpasaṃhitaṃ sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an5.176:4.4.eng: The pleasure and happiness connected with sensual pleasures.

an5.176:4.5.pli: Yampissa akusalūpasaṃhitaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ, tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an5.176:4.5.eng: The pain and sadness connected with the unskillful.

an5.176:4.6.pli: Yampissa akusalūpasaṃhitaṃ sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an5.176:4.6.eng: The pleasure and happiness connected with the unskillful.

an5.176:4.7.pli: Yampissa kusalūpasaṃhitaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ, tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an5.176:4.7.eng: The pain and sadness connected with the skillful.

an5.176:4.8.pli: Yasmiṃ, sāriputta, samaye ariyasāvako pavivekaṃ pītiṃ upasampajja viharati, imānissa pañca ṭhānāni tasmiṃ samaye na hontī”ti.
an5.176:4.8.eng: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, these five things aren’t present in him.”

an5.177:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a lay follower should not engage in these five trades.

an5.177:1.3.eng: Trade in weapons, living creatures, meat, intoxicants, and poisons.

an5.177:1.4.pli: imā kho, bhikkhave, pañca vaṇijjā upāsakena akaraṇīyā”ti.
an5.177:1.4.eng: A lay follower should not engage in these five trades.”

an5.178:1.2.pli: api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
an5.178:1.2.eng: Have you ever seen or heard

an5.178:1.3.eng: of a person who has given up killing living creatures,

an5.178:1.4.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā pāṇātipātā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’”ti?
an5.178:1.4.eng: and the kings have them arrested for that, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires?”

an5.178:1.7.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
an5.178:1.7.eng: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

an5.178:1.9.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā pāṇātipātā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’ti.

an5.178:1.10.pli: Api ca khvassa tatheva pāpakammaṃ pavedenti:
an5.178:1.10.eng: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:

an5.178:1.11.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā jīvitā voropesīti.
an5.178:1.11.eng: ‘This person has murdered a man or a woman.’

an5.178:1.12.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā pāṇātipātahetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karonti.
an5.178:1.12.eng: The kings have them arrested for killing, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires.

an5.178:1.13.pli: Api nu tumhehi evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā’”ti?
an5.178:1.13.eng: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”

an5.178:1.14.eng: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

an5.178:2.2.pli: api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
an5.178:2.2.eng: Have you ever seen or heard

an5.178:2.3.eng: of a person who has given up stealing,

an5.178:2.4.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā adinnādānā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’”ti?
an5.178:2.4.eng: and the kings have them arrested for that …?”

an5.178:2.7.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
an5.178:2.7.eng: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

an5.178:2.9.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā adinnādānā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’ti.

an5.178:2.10.pli: Api ca khvassa tatheva pāpakammaṃ pavedenti:
an5.178:2.10.eng: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:

an5.178:2.11.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyīti.
an5.178:2.11.eng: ‘This person took something from a village or wilderness, with the intention to commit theft.’

an5.178:2.12.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā adinnādānahetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karonti.
an5.178:2.12.eng: The kings have them arrested for stealing …

an5.178:2.13.pli: Api nu tumhehi evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā’”ti?
an5.178:2.13.eng: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”

an5.178:2.14.eng: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

an5.178:3.2.pli: api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
an5.178:3.2.eng: Have you ever seen or heard

an5.178:3.3.eng: of a person who has given up sexual misconduct,

an5.178:3.4.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’”ti?
an5.178:3.4.eng: and the kings have them arrested for that …?”

an5.178:3.7.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
an5.178:3.7.eng: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

an5.178:3.9.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’ti.

an5.178:3.10.pli: Api ca khvassa tatheva pāpakammaṃ pavedenti:
an5.178:3.10.eng: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:

an5.178:3.11.eng: ‘This person had sexual relations with women or maidens under someone else’s protection.’

an5.178:3.12.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā kāmesumicchācārahetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karonti.
an5.178:3.12.eng: The kings have them arrested for that …

an5.178:3.13.pli: Api nu tumhehi evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā’”ti?
an5.178:3.13.eng: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”

an5.178:3.14.eng: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

an5.178:4.2.pli: api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
an5.178:4.2.eng: Have you ever seen or heard

an5.178:4.3.eng: of a person who has given up lying,

an5.178:4.4.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā musāvādā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’”ti?
an5.178:4.4.eng: and the kings have them arrested for that …?”

an5.178:4.7.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
an5.178:4.7.eng: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

an5.178:4.9.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā musāvādā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’ti.

an5.178:4.10.pli: Api ca khvassa tatheva pāpakammaṃ pavedenti:
an5.178:4.10.eng: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:

an5.178:4.11.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā musāvādena atthaṃ pabhañjīti.
an5.178:4.11.eng: ‘This person has ruined a householder or householder’s child by lying.’

an5.178:4.12.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā musāvādahetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karonti.
an5.178:4.12.eng: The kings have them arrested for that …

an5.178:4.13.pli: Api nu tumhehi evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā’”ti?
an5.178:4.13.eng: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”

an5.178:4.14.eng: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

an5.178:5.2.pli: api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
an5.178:5.2.eng: Have you ever seen or heard

an5.178:5.3.eng: of a person who has given up beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants,

an5.178:5.4.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’”ti?
an5.178:5.4.eng: and the kings have them arrested for that, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires?”

an5.178:5.7.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
an5.178:5.7.eng: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

an5.178:5.9.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’ti.

an5.178:5.10.pli: Api ca khvassa tatheva pāpakammaṃ pavedenti:
an5.178:5.10.eng: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:

an5.178:5.11.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ anuyutto itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā jīvitā voropesi;
an5.178:5.11.eng: ‘While under the influence of beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants, this person murdered a woman or a man.

an5.178:5.12.pli: ayaṃ puriso surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ anuyutto gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyi;
an5.178:5.12.eng: Or they stole something from a village or wilderness.

an5.178:5.13.pli: ayaṃ puriso surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ anuyutto paritthīsu parakumārīsu cārittaṃ āpajji;
an5.178:5.13.eng: Or they had sexual relations with women or maidens under someone else’s protection.

an5.178:5.14.pli: ayaṃ puriso surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ anuyutto gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā musāvādena atthaṃ pabhañjīti.
an5.178:5.14.eng: Or they ruined a householder or householder’s child by lying.’

an5.178:5.15.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānahetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karonti.
an5.178:5.15.eng: The kings have them arrested for being under the influence of beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires.

an5.178:5.16.pli: Api nu tumhehi evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā’”ti?
an5.178:5.16.eng: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”

an5.178:5.17.eng: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”
